VLIB_updateUWRMeanS16

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_updateUWRMeanS16 (int16_t *restrict updatedMean, const int16_t *restrict previousMean, const uint8_t *restrict newestData, const uint8_t *restrict oldestData, const uint32_t *restrict newestMask32packed, const uint32_t *restrict oldestMask32packed, const uint32_t pixelCount, const uint8_t frameCount)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_updateUWRMeanS16 ( int16_t *restrict  updatedMean,
const int16_t *restrict  previousMean,
const uint8_t *restrict  newestData,
const uint8_t *restrict  oldestData,
const uint32_t *restrict  newestMask32packed,
const uint32_t *restrict  oldestMask32packed,
const uint32_t  pixelCount,
const uint8_t  frameCount 
)

Description:
The function VLIB_updateUWRMeanS16() updates the uniformly-weighted running mean of a video buffer. This is accomplished by computing the difference between the oldest and newest frames, weighting it appropriately, and adding the result to the current running mean value. If the foreground mask flag bit of either the newest or the oldest data is set, the running mean is not updated for the associated region.
Parameters:
[out] updatedMean Updated running 16-bit mean (SQ8.7)
[in] previousMean Current running 16-bit mean (SQ8.7)
[in] newestData Most recent Luma buffer (UQ8.0)
[in] oldestData Oldest Luma buffer(UQ8.0)
[in] newestMask32packed Most recent foreground object mask (32-bit packed)
[in] oldestMask32packed Oldest foreground object mask (32-bit packed)
[in] pixelCount Number of pixels to process (UQ32.0)
[in] frameCount Number of frames in video buffer being averaged (UQ8.0)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffers are assumed to be double-word aligned and not aliased.
  • The pixelCount must be a multiple of 8.
  • frameCount is greater than 1
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is fully interruptible
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed-point processors
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
